member.summary: Faceting parameters

member.name: P:SolrNet.Commands.Parameters.FacetParameters.Queries
member.summary: Collection of facet queries

member.name: P:SolrNet.Commands.Parameters.FacetParameters.Prefix
member.summary: Limits the terms on which to facet to those starting with the given string prefix.

member.name: P:SolrNet.Commands.Parameters.FacetParameters.Sort
member.summary: Set to true, this parameter indicates that constraints should be sorted by their count. If false, facets will be in their natural index order (unicode). For terms in the ascii range, this will be alphabetically sorted. The default is true if Limit is greater than 0, false otherwise.

member.name: P:SolrNet.Commands.Parameters.FacetParameters.Limit
member.summary: This param indicates the maximum number of constraint counts that should be returned for the facet fields. A negative value means unlimited. The default value is 100.

member.name: P:SolrNet.Commands.Parameters.FacetParameters.Offset
member.summary: This param indicates an offset into the list of constraints to allow paging. The default value is 0.

member.name: P:SolrNet.Commands.Parameters.FacetParameters.MinCount
member.summary: This param indicates the minimum counts for facet fields should be included in the response. The default value is 0.

member.name: P:SolrNet.Commands.Parameters.FacetParameters.Missing
member.summary: Set to true this param indicates that in addition to the Term based constraints of a facet field, a count of all matching results which have no value for the field should be computed Default is false

member.name: P:SolrNet.Commands.Parameters.FacetParameters.EnumCacheMinDf
member.summary: This param indicates the minimum document frequency (number of documents matching a term) for which the filterCache should be used when determining the constraint count for that term. This is only used during the term enumeration method of faceting (field type faceting on multi-valued or full-text fields). A value greater than zero will decrease memory usage of the filterCache, but increase the query time. When faceting on a field with a very large number of terms, and you wish to decrease memory usage, try a low value of 25 to 50 first. The default value is 0, causing the filterCache to be used for all terms in the field.

member.name: P:SolrNet.Commands.Parameters.QueryOptions.FilterQueries
member.summary: This parameter can be used to specify a query that can be used to restrict the super set of documents that can be returned, without influencing score. It can be very useful for speeding up complex queries since the queries specified with fq are cached independently from the main query. This assumes the same Filter is used again for a latter query (i.e. there's a cache hit)

member.name: P:SolrNet.Commands.Parameters.QueryOptions.Stats
member.summary: This parameter can be used to return the stats for a specific query on top of the results that are normally returned. Included in the stats are min, max, sum, count, missing, sumOfSquares, mean, and stddev values.

member.name: P:SolrNet.Commands.Parameters.QueryOptions.Collapse
member.summary: This parameter can be used to collapse - or group - documents by the unique values of a specified field. Included in the results are the number of records by document key and by field value

member.name: P:SolrNet.Commands.Parameters.QueryOptions.ExtraParams
member.summary: Extra arbitrary parameters to be passed in the request querystring

member.name: T:SolrNet.Commands.Parameters.SpellCheckingParameters
member.summary: Spell checking parameters

member.name: P:SolrNet.Commands.Parameters.SpellCheckingParameters.Query
member.summary: The query to spellcheck. If spellcheck.q is defined, then it is used, otherwise the original input query is used. The spellcheck.q parameter is intended to be the original query, minus any extra markup like field names, boosts, etc. If the q parameter is specified, then the SpellingQueryConverter class is used to parse it into tokens, otherwise the WhitesepaceTokenizer is used. The choice of which one to use is up to the application. Essentially, if you have a spelling "ready" version in your application, then it is probably better to send spellcheck.q, otherwise, if you just want Solr to do the job, use the q parameter

member.name: P:SolrNet.Commands.Parameters.SpellCheckingParameters.Build
member.summary: Create the dictionary for use by the SolrSpellChecker. In typical applications, one needs to build the dictionary before using it. However, it may not always be necessary as it is possible to setup the spellchecker with a dictionary that already exists.

member.name: P:SolrNet.Commands.Parameters.SpellCheckingParameters.Reload
member.summary: Reload the spell checker. Depends on the implementation of SolrSpellChecker.reload() but usually means reloading the dictionary

member.name: P:SolrNet.Commands.Parameters.SpellCheckingParameters.Count
member.summary: The maximum number of suggestions to return

member.name: P:SolrNet.Commands.Parameters.SpellCheckingParameters.OnlyMorePopular
member.summary: Only return suggestions that result in more hits for the query than the existing query.

member.name: P:SolrNet.Commands.Parameters.SpellCheckingParameters.Collate
member.summary: Take the best suggestion for each token (if it exists) and construct a new query from the suggestions

member.name: P:SolrNet.Commands.Parameters.SpellCheckingParameters.Dictionary
member.summary: The name of the spellchecker to use. This defaults to "default". Can be used to invoke a specific spellchecker on a per request basis.

member.name: T:SolrNet.Commands.Parameters.HighlightingParameters
member.summary: Highlighting parameters

member.name: P:SolrNet.Commands.Parameters.HighlightingParameters.Fields
member.summary: List of fields to generate highlighted snippets for. If left blank, the fields highlighted for the StandardRequestHandler are the defaultSearchField (or the df param if used) and for the DisMaxRequestHandler the qf fields are used.

member.name: P:SolrNet.Commands.Parameters.HighlightingParameters.Snippets
member.summary: The maximum number of highlighted snippets to generate per field. It is possible for any number of snippets from zero to this value to be generated. If left null, it will use whatever default Solr sets (1 for Solr 1.3)

member.name: P:SolrNet.Commands.Parameters.HighlightingParameters.Fragsize
member.summary: The size, in characters, of fragments to consider for highlighting. 0 indicates that the whole field value should be used (no fragmenting). If left null, it will use whatever default Solr sets (100 for Solr 1.3)

member.name: P:SolrNet.Commands.Parameters.HighlightingParameters.RequireFieldMatch
member.summary: If true, then a field will only be highlighted if the query matched in this particular field (normally, terms are highlighted in all requested fields regardless of which field matched the query). If left null, it will use whatever default Solr sets (false for Solr 1.3)

member.name: P:SolrNet.Commands.Parameters.HighlightingParameters.AlternateField
member.summary: If a snippet cannot be generated (due to no terms matching), you can specify a field to use as the backup/default summary. The default value is to not have a default summary.

member.name: P:SolrNet.Commands.Parameters.HighlightingParameters.BeforeTerm
member.summary: The text which appears before a highlighted term. The default value is "<em>"

member.name: P:SolrNet.Commands.Parameters.HighlightingParameters.AfterTerm
member.summary: The text which appears after a highlighted term. The default value is ""

member.name: P:SolrNet.Commands.Parameters.HighlightingParameters.RegexSlop
member.summary: Factor by which the regex fragmenter can stray from the ideal fragment size (given by hl.fragsize) to accomodate the regular expression. For instance, a slop of 0.2 with fragsize of 100 should yield fragments between 80 and 120 characters in length. It is usually good to provide a slightly smaller fragsize when using the regex fragmenter. The default value is ".6"

member.name: P:SolrNet.Commands.Parameters.HighlightingParameters.RegexPattern
member.summary: The regular expression for fragmenting. This could be used to extract sentences

member.name: P:SolrNet.Commands.Parameters.HighlightingParameters.RegexMaxAnalyzedChars
member.summary: Only analyze this many characters from a field when using the regex fragmenter (after which, the fragmenter produces fixed-sized fragments). Applying a complicated regex to a huge field is expensive. The default value is "10000".

member.summary: Date facet query

member.summary: Creates a date facet query
member.param: The lower bound for the first date range for all Date Faceting on this field
The minimum upper bound for the last date range for all Date Faceting on this field
The size of each date range expressed as an interval to be added to the lower bound using the DateMathParser syntax.

member.name: P:SolrNet.SolrFacetDateQuery.HardEnd
member.summary: What to do in the event that the gap does not divide evenly between start and end. If this is true, the last date range constraint will have an upper bound of end; if false, the last date range will have the smallest possible upper bound greater then end such that the range is exactly gap wide. The default is false.

member.name: P:SolrNet.SolrFacetDateQuery.Other
member.summary: Indicates that in addition to the counts for each date range constraint between start and end, counts should also be computed for other

member.name: T:SolrNet.SolrFacetFieldQuery
member.summary: Facet field query

member.name: P:SolrNet.SolrFacetFieldQuery.Field
member.summary: Facet field

member.name: P:SolrNet.SolrFacetFieldQuery.Prefix
member.summary: Limits the terms on which to facet to those starting with the given string prefix.

member.name: P:SolrNet.SolrFacetFieldQuery.Sort
member.summary: Set to true, this parameter indicates that constraints should be sorted by their count. If false, facets will be in their natural index order (unicode). For terms in the ascii range, this will be alphabetically sorted. The default is true if Limit is greater than 0, false otherwise.

member.name: P:SolrNet.SolrFacetFieldQuery.Limit
member.summary: This param indicates the maximum number of constraint counts that should be returned for the facet fields. A negative value means unlimited. The default value is 100.

member.name: P:SolrNet.SolrFacetFieldQuery.Offset
member.summary: This param indicates an offset into the list of constraints to allow paging. The default value is 0.

member.name: P:SolrNet.SolrFacetFieldQuery.MinCount
member.summary: This param indicates the minimum counts for facet fields should be included in the response. The default value is 0.

member.name: P:SolrNet.SolrFacetFieldQuery.Missing
member.summary: Set to true this param indicates that in addition to the Term based constraints of a facet field, a count of all matching results which have no value for the field should be computed Default is false

member.name: P:SolrNet.SolrFacetFieldQuery.EnumCacheMinDf
member.summary: This param indicates the minimum document frequency (number of documents matching a term) for which the filterCache should be used when determining the constraint count for that term. This is only used during the term enumeration method of faceting (field type faceting on multi-valued or full-text fields). A value greater than zero will decrease memory usage of the filterCache, but increase the query time. When faceting on a field with a very large number of terms, and you wish to decrease memory usage, try a low value of 25 to 50 first. The default value is 0, causing the filterCache to be used for all terms in the field.
